Questo shoot’em up prende a piene mani da quello che forse è stato uno dei primi (e più importanti) giochi arcade di sempre, uno di quei titoli che non solo viene citato tuttora in buona parte dei nuovi prodotti videoludici, ma che si è ritagliato grosse, grossissime porzioni d’importanza in tutti gli altri media, e nella cultura degli anni 80. Davvero, se non avete idea dello spessore e dell’importanza di Space Invaders, chiedete a qualche ometto occhialuto di almeno 40 anni, e vi assicuriamo che si perderà nei suoi ricordi… come potrebbe capitare in fondo con chi è cresciuto nell’era Tetris. Ad ogni modo, Titan Attacks vuole essere un vero e proprio omaggio al suo antenato, un tributo di quelli che, a volte, sembrano una semplice rappresentazione moderna. Nel gioco di Puppy Games, infatti, le novità in termini di gameplay sono pressoché nulle: nonostante i 30 e passa anni che ci dividono dall’uscita del gioco di Tomohiro Nishikado, Titan Attacks ripropone buona parte delle stesse situazioni già viste, velocizzando il gioco, aumentando la varietà dei nemici, e introducendo alcune piccole idee interessanti che, però, non fanno che stimolare il gioco solo in previsione di una totale conquista degli achievement.

This is a nice little game if you like Space Invaders. Beware of the thumb cramp though.

Titan Attacks comes with upgrade mechanics. You can improve your little tank so that it has more weapons, more shields (more life in other words), more possibilities to clear the waves of enemies descending on you. You can even kill the pilots ejecting of their vessels, or let them escape, or to capture them.

The more you're cleaning planets, the more difficult you'll have to pass level after level.

As I've said, a thumb cramp can happen if you play too much the game, it's kinda addictive on the moment but after a while where you're not really advancing because you're too slow or because your choices didn't suit you.

What is great with Titan Attacks is the retro graphics mixed with very bright colors. It's flashy, it's enjoyable, it's really smooth with the eye. The soundtrack is also correct.

Titan Attacks is a real little joy and a good Space Invaders-like. Do yourself a favor and buy it.

I bought this game long ago before Revenge of the Titans came out and it hooked it's claws into me and was really the first Space Invader type game I loved.. I mean, I love quite a lot of older games from the period Titan Attacks is homaging, (Atlantis on the Atari 2600 <3<3), just never got into Space Invaders type games. Until this game. 1814292.review:
If you've played Space Invaders (and who hasn't at some point?) then you already know what this game is about.  

That said, it's not a direct clone.  There are upgrades you can get, along with some special weapons.  

Yeah, I know.  This doesn't sound very exciting.  Well, it's not the most thrilling game in the world, but it's cheap, easy to play (in that it requires virtually no time commitment), and has extremely low PC requirements.  So it's a good little time waster, for those situations where you've got too much time to just sit around, but not enough time to play a more in-depth game.

Something else this game has -- that I really like -- is it saves your game whenever you exit, no matter where you are or what you're doing.  It's more of a "save state" in that your saved game is erased as soon as you load it.  There are checkpoints are certain intervals, so if you die you don't need to start from the beginning (but you might have to redo a few levels).

If you've got young kids, this would be a good game for them as well.  It's not overly complex and there's no adult themes to worry about.

Space Invaders, but better. Now, before you jump out of your chair and yell 'BUT THAT'S NOT POSSIBLE!', hear me out.

Titan Attacks! is a wonderful looking indie title. The story is rather simple and there's absolutely no way to truly spoil it. Aliens have attacked Earth and destroyed every single weapon on our planet, save for one tank - the one you, as the player shall control. Your task is to drive the aliens from Earth all the way to their home planet (technically a moon) and deal with them once and for all!

To make this mission (slightly) easier, you are given many purchasable upgrades in-between fights. Use the cash you earn to buy extra weapons for your tank, make your bullets do more damage or get a handful of borderline 'I WIN' button nukes.

The game is fast-paced and fun. It certainly isn't long, but it has quite a bit of replay value. Oh, it's cheap as well! I'd suggest getting it the next time you're looking for a new game to play - trust me, it's totally worth it.

1985658.review:
Titan Attacks is a modern remake of Space Invaders with a neat retro aesthetic. It's purely an arcade-style experience: start a game and continue until you die, going for the high score. Your score will mostly be determined by how long you can go without taking a single hit; one hit won't kill you, but it will reset your multiplier that increases when you beat a level. You also buy upgrades between levels, which are vital to surviving later in the game. 

If this sounds interesting to you, then it's probably worth picking up. The gameplay is solid, the art and sound is pretty cool, it controls pretty well once you get a few powerups, and the replay value is great. There are certainly many worse ways to spend five dollars, and this game is certainly worth it if you can find it cheaper.

2078435.review: 表面上看，是小蜜蜂，多玩玩这货根本不是小蜜蜂！倒是很像Popcap早期的一款射击游戏Heavy Weapon。丰富的升级，绝对不枯燥的游戏进程，以及后期很高的难度给了玩家更多的挑战。尼玛加分关绝对坑爹啊，想全中真的难比登天啊。。。即使后期有了超猛火力也不容易全中。。。最坑爹的是，全中了的奖励居然只有1000块！！！而命中85%以上送一个炸弹，后期一个炸弹都要1000多。。。真不知道忙活了半天是为什么。。。

882396.review: Titan Attacks! is a modern reimagining of the fixed shooters of the coin-op era, combining elements from Space Invaders, Galaga, and those of modern games such as persistent ship upgrades, fast mouse control, and collectable temporary buffs like those seen in contemporary scrolling shoot-em-ups. Anyone who has played either of the aforementioned titles will feel right at home with this game, and find its faster pace, increased variety, and greater sense of progression to be a perfect cocktail of old and new, resulting in a unique experience that is difficult to walk away from. Puppy Games clearly have a love for the genre, and understand exaclty what made it so popular. This shows in everything from the mechanics all the way to the beautiful art design. Fan of the classics or not, Titan Attacks! is a labor of love, and a game you can't afford to miss.

3676162.review: Titan attack is a fantastic throw-back game that competently combines the retro style of space invaders with modern technical tweaks. If you’re looking for something super revolutionary here, you’re not looking in the right place. This game is simply bringing the classics in to the 21st century, it’s an upgraded space invaders. Some new features include upgrade/repair menus in between each level completion, saves, and boss fights. While the boss fights is a welcoming edition, the fights are nothing short of boring as hell. The bosses are actually just oversized ships with the same firepower as the regular mission ships. The game has no difficulty options, but it does loop and get increasingly difficult the longer you survive. Sadly if you die once, you will have to redo everything over again. The musical score is quite shit, that might act as deterrent for further play-through. Overall not bad for a remake, but something about it really makes me hate playing it again after dying.

Titans attack это новый взгляд на классическую и культовую игру Space Invaders, которая является новым взглядом на историю связанную с атакой титанов с планеты Титан. Защитить Землю, Луну, Марс и Сатурн, а также уничтожить титанов на родной планете - вот наша главная задача! Динамичная, красивая, увлекательная и просто веселая игра, которая более чем заслуживает внимания аудитории всех возрастов.7/10

Спасибо компании Puppygames за предоставление эксклюзивного ключа.

407849.review:
Space Invaders for 2012! Well, it should be, but there's too much of a good thing going on here. As the game is full of unlocks, such as smart-bombs, extra cannons, firing rate increases, shields, etc - it can all get a little too chaotic. 

The devs would do well to take a leaf out of Popcap's book here with their Bejeweled games and Zen Mode. Such modes are geared far more towards a casual and 'relaxing' play through of the game - than a hectic, luck riddled blast. Titan Attacks should have a pure, Space Invaders clone-type mode.

The biggest criticism of the game however, is the lack of save point as you progress. Rather than the game saving each mini campaign as you progress from the Earth, onto the Moon and onwards - once you die you have to redo the entire mini campaign again. It's massively draining and frustrating in equal measure and I very much doubt I'll see the game through because of it. The stress simply isn't justified to reach the end! 5.5/10

584331.review:
Titan Attacks! is one of the better-presented wheel-reinventings of Space Invaders. Playing this game format with a mouse may seem counter intuitive at first, but it leads to intensely strategic enemy fire-dodging. The upgrade system moves at an satisfying (if slightly stiff and expensive) clip, and the MacSpeak computer voice doing all the voicing is cute.
I would compare this to Space Invaders Extreme for the Nintendo DS, which was Atari's own suite of variations on the classic. Enemies are rendered in almost the same way. Both are great games that get REALLY challenging very quickly.

811469.review:
A nice Space Invaders clone with modern retro graphics (yeah, well, just see it in action). There are 5 planets, with 20 waves each. After that, you start at the beginning again. Obviously, the worlds get harder as you progress through the game. It never gets frustrating though. Like Space Invaders the goal of the game is to collect points. You do this by shooting down alien ships and catching (or shooting) the aliens that ocassionally drop. Every now and then you have the chance to collect power-ups by shooting a flying saucer or finishing a bonus stage. Oh, I almost forgot to mention that you have the ability to upgrade your vehicle after every wave. Think shields, more guns, more bullets, missiles et cetera. It's all good fun.
And to give you an indication; the game can be finished in 1,5-2 hours.

[Rating: 73/100]
